alert.note: Alert for City and Borough of Juneau (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Blizzard Warning issued March 01 at 11:52AM AKST until March 01 at 6:00PM AKST by NWS Juneau
info.description: ...HEAVY SNOW THROUGH WEDNESDAY NIGHT FOR THE NORTHERN AND CENTRAL PANHANDLE... A storm force low over northern gulf coast continues to send plently of moisture and wind into the panhandle today. Snowfall amounts of 5 to 10 inches have been reported over the northern inner channels and portions of the central inner channels Wednesday morning. Some blowing snow has also been seen with visibilities down to a quarter mile or less at times. The southern panhandle and Sitka have warmed enough to change to rain, but have been seeing gusts to 45 mph. ...BLIZZARD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM AKST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Blizzard conditions. Heavy snow and blowing snow with visibilities down to a quarter mile or less. Additional snow accumulations of 4 to 6 inches. Winds gusting as high as 45 mph. * WHERE...City and Borough of Juneau. * WHEN...Until 6 PM AKST this evening. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. Areas of blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the evening commute. Gusty winds could bring down tree branches. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Juneau airport and downtown areas have been gusting to 45 mph for the last few hours with visibilities due to snow and blowing snow down to a quarter mile or less since around 9 am. Expect these conditions to continue through the afternoon and possibly into the evening.
info.instruction: Travel should be restricted to emergencies only. If you must travel, have a winter survival kit with you. If you get stranded, stay with your vehicle. For the latest road conditions call 5 1 1 or visit 511.alaska.gov.
